tasks.title: Set up project structure and dependencies
tasks.description: Create the necessary directory structure (src/, doc/, results/) and set up Python dependencies including numpy, scipy, opencv, matplotlib

tasks.title: Implement CTSlice - Direct Fourier Reconstruction
tasks.description: Implement the Direct Fourier Reconstruction method using Fourier Slice Theorem. Function takes sinogram and angle range (180° or 360°) as input and returns reconstructed CT slice. Must use fftshift/ifftshift for correct phase information. Works only for parallel projection.

subtasks.title: Implement Fourier Slice Theorem
subtasks.description: Develop the core algorithm using the Fourier Slice Theorem for CT reconstruction.
subtasks.details: Use FFT to transform the sinogram, apply the Fourier Slice Theorem, and ensure correct phase information with fftshift/ifftshift.

subtasks.title: Handle Input/Output for CTSlice Function
subtasks.description: Design the function interface to accept sinogram and angle range, and output the reconstructed CT slice.
subtasks.details: Ensure the function accepts inputs for sinogram and angle range (180° or 360°) and outputs the reconstructed image.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with various input formats and validate output structure.

subtasks.title: Test CTSlice with Sample Data
subtasks.description: Validate the implementation using sample sinograms and compare results with expected outputs.
subtasks.details: Use sample sinograms to test the reconstruction accuracy and performance of the CTSlice function.
subtasks.testStrategy: Compare reconstructed slices with ground truth images.

tasks.title: Implement CTRadon - Filtered Backprojection
tasks.description: Implement Filtered Backprojection (FBP) method. Apply filter to sinogram before backprojection to remove blurriness. Function takes sinogram and angle range as input. May use OpenCV's getRotationMatrix2D and warpAffine. Cannot use skimage's iradon in implementation (only for comparison). Works only for parallel projection.

subtasks.title: Implement Sinogram Filtering Process
subtasks.description: Develop the filtering process to apply to the sinogram before backprojection.
subtasks.details: Use a suitable filter to process the sinogram data to reduce blurriness. Ensure compatibility with parallel projection.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify filter effectiveness by comparing filtered and unfiltered outputs.

subtasks.title: Develop Backprojection Algorithm
subtasks.description: Create the backprojection algorithm to reconstruct the image from the filtered sinogram.
subtasks.details: Implement the backprojection using OpenCV's getRotationMatrix2D and warpAffine. Avoid using skimage's iradon.
subtasks.testStrategy: Compare reconstructed images with skimage's iradon results for accuracy.

subtasks.title: Handle Input and Output for FBP Function
subtasks.description: Design the input and output handling for the Filtered Backprojection function.
subtasks.details: Ensure the function accepts sinogram and angle range as inputs and outputs the reconstructed image.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with various input sizes and angle ranges to ensure robustness.

subtasks.title: Test and Validate FBP Implementation
subtasks.description: Conduct thorough testing and validation of the entire Filtered Backprojection implementation.
subtasks.details: Develop test cases to validate the accuracy and performance of the FBP method. Use skimage's iradon for comparison.
subtasks.testStrategy: Perform unit tests and compare results with known benchmarks.

tasks.title: Implement Rebinning algorithm
tasks.description: Implement rebinning to convert divergent projection (fan-beam) sinograms to parallel projection sinograms. Function takes sinogram and parameters (FOD, FDD, sensor width, center offset) as input. Must account for Y-axis pointing downward in image coordinate systems. Output is rebinned sinogram usable by CTSlice and CTRadon.

subtasks.title: Research Rebinning Process
subtasks.description: Understand the mathematical and computational aspects of rebinning from fan-beam to parallel-beam sinograms.
subtasks.details: Study relevant literature and existing algorithms for rebinning. Focus on the transformation of coordinates and handling of input parameters like FOD, FDD, sensor width, and center offset.

subtasks.title: Implement Core Rebinning Algorithm
subtasks.description: Develop the core algorithm to convert fan-beam sinograms to parallel-beam sinograms.
subtasks.details: Use insights from research to implement the algorithm. Ensure the Y-axis is correctly oriented downward in the image coordinate system. Validate the output against expected parallel-beam sinograms.
subtasks.testStrategy: Compare output with known parallel-beam sinograms and validate using CTSlice and CTRadon.

subtasks.title: Handle Edge Cases in Rebinning
subtasks.description: Identify and implement solutions for potential edge cases in the rebinning process.
subtasks.details: Consider scenarios such as extreme values of FOD, FDD, and center offset. Ensure robustness against unusual input configurations.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with edge case inputs and verify stability and correctness of the output.

subtasks.title: Develop Testing Suite for Rebinning Algorithm
subtasks.description: Create a comprehensive testing suite to validate the rebinning algorithm.
subtasks.details: Design unit tests and integration tests to cover typical and edge case scenarios. Ensure compatibility with CTSlice and CTRadon outputs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Automate tests to run against a variety of input sinograms and parameters, ensuring consistent and correct rebinning.

tasks.title: Implement Sinogram Generation
tasks.description: Implement method to generate sinograms from arbitrary images. This is the forward Radon transform. Should support different numbers of angles and projection types.

tasks.title: Test with parallel projection data
tasks.description: Test CTSlice and CTRadon implementations with provided parallel projection sinograms (SheppLoganPhantom, Lotus, Walnut). Compare results between both methods. Test with both 180° and 360° angle ranges.

tasks.title: Test with divergent projection data
tasks.description: Test Rebinning algorithm with provided divergent projection sinograms (lotus_divergent, walnut_divergent). Use rebinned output with CTSlice and CTRadon. Compare reconstruction quality before and after rebinning.

tasks.title: Conduct sinogram generation experiments
tasks.description: Test sinogram generation with custom images. Analyze: (1) impact of number of angles on reconstruction quality, (2) possibility of exact reconstruction, (3) application to photos. Document observations for report.

tasks.title: Implement extra features (optional)
tasks.description: For higher grade: (1) Auto-detect if sinogram is 180° or 360°, (2) Auto-detect if sensor images are stacked horizontally or vertically, (3) Implement additional filter methods for FBP.

subtasks.title: Implement Auto-Detection for Sinogram Angle
subtasks.description: Develop a feature to auto-detect if a sinogram is 180° or 360°.
subtasks.details: Create an algorithm to analyze sinogram data and determine the angle range. Use statistical methods to differentiate between 180° and 360° sinograms.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with known 180° and 360° sinograms to verify accuracy.

subtasks.title: Implement Auto-Detection for Sensor Image Orientation
subtasks.description: Develop a feature to auto-detect if sensor images are stacked horizontally or vertically.
subtasks.details: Analyze image metadata and pixel patterns to determine orientation. Implement logic to handle both horizontal and vertical stacking.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with sample images in both orientations to ensure correct detection.

subtasks.title: Develop Additional Filter Methods for FBP
subtasks.description: Implement new filter methods for the Filtered Backprojection (FBP) process.
subtasks.details: Research and implement additional filters such as Hamming and Hann. Integrate these filters into the existing FBP workflow.
subtasks.testStrategy: Compare reconstruction quality using different filters on sample sinograms.

tasks.title: Create comprehensive documentation
tasks.description: Write 5-page report (PDF) describing: (1) Content of src directory, (2) Program usage instructions, (3) Implementation details of each algorithm, (4) Experimental results and observations, (5) Mathematical background and theory.

tasks.title: Prepare final submission package
tasks.description: Create .zip archive with three directories: src/ (Python code and input data), doc/ (PDF report), results/ (input/output images). Ensure code is easily executable. Verify all requirements are met for submission deadline (January 22, 2026).
